title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: F. M. Bird to Thomas P. Jackson, October 28, 1867
summary: Bird's letter to Jackson asks for protection for him and other men who fought for the Union during the war. Bird, a resident of Highland County, describes threats and attacks against him by men still loyal to the Confederacy.
keywords: Legal System, Patriotism, Politics/Political Attitudes, Violence/Crime, Military Authority, American Civil War
